title: Paul Asquith
text:
Paul Asquith (born 12 August 1993) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. His primary position is centre, but is also an accomplished fly-half and fullback who can also play on the wing.
Career.
Asquith played his junior <a href="Rugby%20union">Rugby union</a> for <a href="Kiama%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Kiama, New South Wales</a> and junior <a href="Rugby%20league">Rugby league</a> for his home town <a href="Jamberoo%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Jamberoo, New South Wales</a> as well as Kiama. He was chosen for the <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George Dragons</a> <a href="S.%20G.%20Ball%20Cup">S. G. Ball Cup</a> team in 2010 before moving to <a href="Rugby%20sevens">Rugby sevens</a> in 2012. He played 43 games for <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Australia</a> during the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2012-13</a> and <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2013-14</a> seasons.
He made his debut for the Rebels against the <a href="Stormers">Stormers</a> in a 57-31 defeat at <a href="Melbourne%20Rectangular%20Stadium">AAMI Park</a> coming on as a replacement for <a href="Jonah%20Placid">Jonah Placid</a> who went off injured in the process of scoring a try. He plays his club rugby for <a href="Southern%20Districts%20Rugby%20Club">Southern Districts</a> in Sydney and also for the <a href="Greater%20Sydney%20Rams">Greater Sydney Rams</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20Championship">National Rugby Championship</a>.
In July 2017, he joined <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in Wales for the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Scarlets%20season">2017-18 season</a>. He played all three trial games and made his <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> debut off the bench again in the first round against the <a href="Southern%20Kings">Southern Kings</a> and scored his first try in the second round against <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a>.
